title: Harvesting and Post-Harvest Handling of Potatoes in Saline Conditions

questions.question: What is the primary challenge when determining the optimal harvest time for potatoes grown in saline conditions?
Which of the following is NOT a common method for assessing potato maturity?
How does salinity typically affect the skin of potatoes?
choices: Makes it thicker and more resistant to damage
Causes it to become more susceptible to damage
Has no effect on potato skin
questions.answer: Causes it to become more susceptible to damage

questions.question: What is the recommended relative humidity for curing potatoes after harvest?
How long should the curing process for potatoes typically last?
What is the primary purpose of curing potatoes after harvest?
choices: To allow minor wounds to heal and skin to set fully
questions.answer: To allow minor wounds to heal and skin to set fully

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential effect of salinity on potato storage life?
What is the optimal storage temperature for most potato varieties?
Why might potatoes grown in saline conditions require slightly higher storage temperatures?
What is the recommended relative humidity for storing potatoes?
Why is proper ventilation important in potato storage facilities?
choices: To prevent condensation and reduce disease risk
questions.answer: To prevent condensation and reduce disease risk

questions.question: What is the primary risk of overfilling containers during potato harvest?
choices: Pressure damage to tubers at the bottom
questions.answer: Pressure damage to tubers at the bottom

questions.question: How does salinity typically affect the specific gravity of potatoes?
choices: It has no effect on specific gravity
It can alter specific gravity compared to normal conditions
questions.answer: It can alter specific gravity compared to normal conditions

questions.question: What is the main advantage of hand harvesting potatoes in heavily salt-affected areas?
How often should stored potatoes be monitored for quality issues?
What should be done with potatoes showing signs of deterioration during storage?
choices: Leave them in storage to see if they improve
Mix them with healthy tubers to average out quality
Remove them promptly to prevent spread of problems
questions.answer: Remove them promptly to prevent spread of problems

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical effect of salt stress on potatoes?
What is the purpose of the skin set test in determining potato maturity?
choices: To check if the skin peels off easily
questions.answer: To check if the skin peels off easily

questions.question: How should mechanical harvesters be adjusted when harvesting salt-stressed potatoes?
choices: Adjust for appropriate speeds and depths to reduce injury risk
questions.answer: Adjust for appropriate speeds and depths to reduce injury risk

questions.question: What is the primary reason for maintaining high humidity during potato storage?
choices: To prevent moisture loss and maintain tuber quality
questions.answer: To prevent moisture loss and maintain tuber quality

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential consequence of improper ventilation in potato storage?
What is the recommended temperature range for curing potatoes after harvest?
How does salt stress typically affect the dormancy period of potatoes?
choices: It has no effect on dormancy

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of measuring specific gravity in potatoes?
Which of the following is NOT a recommended practice when harvesting salt-stressed potatoes?
choices: Allowing potatoes to dry on the surface briefly
Training workers in gentle handling techniques

questions.question: What is the ideal air exchange rate for potato storage facilities?
choices: 1-5 times the storage volume per hour
10-20 times the storage volume per hour
30-40 times the storage volume per hour
50-60 times the storage volume per hour
questions.answer: 10-20 times the storage volume per hour

questions.question: How does salinity typically affect the respiration rate of stored potatoes?
choices: It has no effect on respiration rate

questions.question: What is the primary reason for avoiding drops and impacts during potato harvest?
choices: To avoid bruising and internal damage
questions.answer: To avoid bruising and internal damage

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential benefit of slightly higher storage temperatures for salt-stressed potatoes?
What is the recommended method for measuring dry matter content in potatoes?
